intro: Rorippa aspera, commonly known as the rough watercress, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as stream banks, ditches, and wet meadows. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture, while its stems are usually prostrate or ascending. Rorippa aspera is an annual or biennial herb that plays a role in aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
